Xpander Crossover Bisa Ancam Daihatsu Terios, Ini Respon ADM
07 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Wira Utama, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Mitsubishi Krama Yudha Motors Sales Indonesia dikabarkan akan mengeluarkan varian baru Xpander Crossover. Mobil ini disebut akan mengancam pasar LSUV seperti Daihatsu Terios.
Terkait itu, Direktur Marketing Astra Daihatsu Motor, Amelia Tjandra menanggapi santai. Menurut dia, kalau penjualan suatu produk mulai menurun maka memang perlu ada inovasi termasuk menciptakan produk baru yang berbeda segmen.
"Bagus saja, karena teorinya itu kan, habis naik maka akan turun. Jadi kalau mau naik lagi, ya harus keluarkan varian baru. Itu strategi normal yang dilakukan juga semua pemain,"ujarnya di kawasan Senayan, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Ame menegaskan bahwa kehadiran versi terbaru yang diduga berbasis Mitsubishi Xpander tidak akan mengancam pasar Daihatsu Terios. Alasannya karena kedua brand ini memiliki segmen konsumen yang berbeda. Sudah pakem di masing-masing merek.
"Dari dulu saya bilang, Mitsubishi berdasarkan survei bukan kompetitor langsung Daihatsu. Study kita itu yang beli Terios gak pernah mempertimbangkan Mitsubishi. Yang beli Mitsubishi gak pernah juga mempertimbangkan Terios. Jadi beda segmen konsumen,"kata Amel.
Lebjh lanjut, dia menjelaskan bahwa langkah Mitsubishi menyegarkan produknya adalag hal biasa yang memang harus dilakukan oleh suatu perusahaan.Jadi saya merasa biasa aja, kata Amel, dengan apa yang dilakukan Mitsubishi atau merek lain. Sebab, itu memang harus dilakukan.
"Temasuk Daihatsu juga. Jadi biasa aja, Honda juga itu kan ngeluarin Mobilio terus dijadiin B-RV. Jadi semua memang begitu,"ujarnya.

Xpander Crossover Can Threaten Daihatsu Terios, This is the ADM Response
07 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Wira Utama, Eko Ari Wibowo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Mitsubishi Krama Yudha Motors Sales Indonesia is rumored to be releasing a new variant of the Xpander Crossover. This car is said to threaten the LSUV market such as the Daihatsu Terios.
Related to that, Astra Daihatsu Motor's Marketing Director, Amelia Tjandra responded casually. According to him, if the sales of a product start to decline then there needs to be innovation including creating new products with different segments.
"It's good, because the theory is right, it will go up then it will go down. So if you want to go up again, you have to take out a new variant. That's the normal strategy for all players," he said in the Senayan area, Central Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019 .
Ame asserted that the presence of the latest version of the allegedly based Mitsubishi Xpander will not threaten the Daihatsu Terios market. The reason is because these two brands have different consumer segments. It's standard in each brand.
"From the first time I said, Mitsubishi based on the survey was not a direct competitor of Daihatsu. Our study, the one who bought Terios never considered Mitsubishi. The one who bought Mitsubishi never considered Terios. So the consumer segment was different," Amel said.
He went on, he explained that Mitsubishi's move to refresh its products was a normal thing for a company to do. So I felt normal, Amel said, with what Mitsubishi or other brands were doing. Because, it must be done.
"This includes Daihatsu as well. So it's normal, Honda also releases Mobilio and continues to be B-RV. So everything is like that," he said.
